newsitem.title: USA: General Patent names seven firms in patent suit.
newsitem.headline: General Patent names seven firms in patent suit.

text.p: General Patent Corp, a technology transfer company, said Tuesday it named seven companies, including modem market leaders Hayes Microcomputer Products Inc and Boca Research Inc, in a patent infringement suit.
General Patent said it filed the complaint in a federal district court in Orange County, Calif.

In a statement, General Patent said the other companies it sued are Cardinal Technologies Inc, a Lancaster, Pa., company recently acquired by Hayes; Xircom Inc, of Thousand Oaks, Calif.; GVC Technologies, which does business under the name MaxTech Corp, of Cerritos, Calif.; Archtek America Corp, of City of Industry, Calif.; and New Media Corp, of Irvine, Calif.
General Patent said its lawsuit seeks to enforce four of its patents which cover spescific aspects of personal computer card modems, the credit-card size modems used in notebook and laptop PCs.
In March, General Patent filed a similar lawsuit against International Business Machines Corp and U.S. Robotics Corp, which in June merged with 3Com Corp.

"Every company manufacturing or selling PC Cards owes it to themselves to take a close look at our patents and consider takaing a license," said Alexander Poltorak, General Patent's chairman and chief executive officer.

The company said that the patents it alleged to be infringed are U.S. Patent Nos. 4,603,320, known as Connector Interface; 4,543,450, Integrated Connector and Modem; 4,686,506, Multiple Connector Interface; and 4,972,470, programmable connector.
